nl_problem:
# Task: Nested Logic Test (Depth 15)
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: checkNested(self, x0: int, x1: int, x2: int, x3: int, x4: int, x5: int, x6: int, x7: int, x8: int, x9: int, x10: int, x11: int, x12: int, x13: int, x14: int) -> bool

# Objective:
This is a test of structural nesting. Return True ONLY if all the following conditions are met:
1. x0 is greater than 0
2. x1 is greater than 0
3. x2 is greater than 0
4. x3 is greater than 0
5. x4 is greater than 0
6. x5 is greater than 0
7. x6 is greater than 0
8. x7 is greater than 0
9. x8 is greater than 0
10. x9 is greater than 0
11. x10 is greater than 0
12. x11 is greater than 0
13. x12 is greater than 0
14. x13 is greater than 0
15. x14 is greater than 0

Each condition must be checked inside the previous one (nested if statements).
lisp_spec:
(task
 (name "checkNested")
 (signature ( (self any) (x0 int) (x1 int) (x2 int) (x3 int) (x4 int) (x5 int) (x6 int) (x7 int) (x8 int) (x9 int) (x10 int) (x11 int) (x12 int) (x13 int) (x14 int) ) bool)
 (constraints
   (constraint "All integers must be greater than 0.")
 )
 (goal
   (description "Return True if all integers from x0 to x14 are greater than 0, checked in nested conditions.")
   (rule "Each condition checks if the current integer is greater than 0 and only proceeds if true.")
   (return "True if all conditions are met; otherwise, False.")
 )
)
